question: [File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Allocation pattern] Does BooleanTransactionFilter::new_from_proto() allocate all filter data upfront or lazily, and can attackers exploit eager allocation to cause memory spikes? (Medium)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [CPU exhaustion] Can complex filter validation in new_from_proto() take excessive CPU time, allowing attackers to slow down indexer request processing with valid but complex filters? (Low)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Address parsing vulnerability] Can malformed address strings in filters cause panics in standardize_address() during filter validation, crashing the service before returning Status error? (Medium)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Module name injection] Can special characters or path traversal sequences in module/function name filters cause unexpected behavior in string matching logic? (Low)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Prost library vulnerability] Does the underlying prost protobuf library have known vulnerabilities in Message::encoded_len() or deserialization that could be exploited through this interface? (Medium)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Tonic status conversion] Can Status::invalid_argument construction fail or panic under certain error conditions, causing the service to crash instead of returning an error? (Low)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [AND short-circuit bypass] Do LogicalAnd filters properly short-circuit evaluation, or do they evaluate all sub-filters even when early filters don't match, wasting resources? (Low)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [OR short-circuit bypass] Do LogicalOr filters short-circuit on first match, or do they evaluate all sub-filters allowing timing attacks to infer filter structure? (Low)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Filter combination explosion] Can an attacker combine multiple filter types (TransactionRoot + UserTransaction + Event) in complex AND/OR trees to create filters that individually pass size limits but collectively overwhelm the matcher? (Medium)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Nested filter limit] Is there a maximum nesting depth enforced for And(Or(And(Or(...)))), or can arbitrarily deep nesting cause stack overflow during recursive matching? (High)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Filter state mutation] After parse_transaction_filter() returns a BooleanTransactionFilter, can its internal state be mutated through unsafe code or interior mutability, causing inconsistent matching? (Low)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Validation state bypass] Does is_valid() get called during new_from_proto() or only on first use, allowing invalid filters to exist transiently? (Medium)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Filter lifetime] When filters are passed to long-running streams, can changes to transaction schema or protobuf definitions cause previously valid filters to become invalid mid-stream? (Medium)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Batch processing inconsistency] When the same filter is applied to multiple transaction batches, can differences in batch composition cause non-deterministic matching behavior? (Low)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Partial parse state] If new_from_proto() fails midway through parsing nested filters, are partially constructed filter objects properly dropped or can they leak memory? (Low)

[File: ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/filter_utils.rs] [Function: parse_transaction_filter()] [Retry amplification] Can clients retry with the same malicious filter repeatedly, and if so, do rate limits prevent this from becoming a DoS vector? (Medium)
